course.name: Done is better - Build What Matters

questions.question: A stakeholder says a task is "done when it feels right." What should you do?
options: Define done as a testable, observable condition; refuse vague done criteria
Accept their definition even though it cannot be verified or tested
Set an arbitrary deadline without defining what done actually means
Leave it undefined and hope everyone agrees on when it is complete

questions.question: A developer says a feature is "done" but cannot describe how to verify it works. According to this approach, what is the problem?
options: Done means testable: if you cannot verify or test it, it does not exist as done
Done means the deadline passed regardless of quality or outcomes
Done means the person in charge says so without verification
Done means no one is complaining about it at the moment

questions.question: Your next move is "improve the onboarding flow." How do you make it testable?
options: Write: we are done when [observable condition], e.g. user completes steps 1â€“3 in under 2 minutes
Leave it as is and do not define done criteria or testability
Set a due date only without other criteria or observable conditions
Assign it to a team and do not define done or how to verify completion

questions.question: Why is vague done dangerous?
options: Scope creep and no feedback; you never know when to stop or what to test
It is faster to avoid defining clear criteria or testable conditions
It is more flexible and allows for creative interpretation
It has no effect on outcomes or learning compared to clear definitions

questions.question: Moving on before the test is run can lead to:
options: False confidence; the move may not be done or may not produce the expected result
Faster delivery with no downside
Lower cost with the same outcome
No significant risk in most cases

questions.question: If you cannot write an observable condition for "done," what should you do?
options: Narrow the move until you can define a testable condition that can be verified
Proceed anyway without a testable condition and hope it works out
Skip the move and do something else that is easier to define
Ask someone else to define it for you without understanding it yourself

questions.question: What is the role of testability in scoping the next move?
options: It defines the boundary of the move and when you can get signal
It is only for QA and not for planning
It increases scope and flexibility
It has no role in scoping or delivery
